titles.title: To provide for an exchange of lands with the Water Conservancy District of Washington County, Utah.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Lands.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 104-306.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 158.

action.text: Mr. Cooley moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Forests and Public Lands.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 6/14/1995--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to transfer to the Water Conservancy District of Washington County, Utah, the Sand Hollow Site, the Quail Creek Pipeline, and the Quail Creek Reservoir, if the District offers to transfer to the United States the Bulloch Site in Kane County, excluding water rights. Withdraws the mineral interests underlying the Sand Hollow Site, the Quail Creek Reservoir, and the Quail Creek Pipeline from disposition under the public land laws, from location, entry, and patent under U.S. mining laws, and from the operation of the U.S. mineral leasing laws, the Geothermal Steam Act of 1970, and the Act of July 31, 1947. Conditions the exchange of lands upon the District's agreement to continue to permit the grazing of domestic livestock on the Sand Hollow Site under existing Federal grazing leases or permits.
